item.description:
Katahdin and Baxter State Park
Looming a mile above the northern Maine wilderness, Katahdin (5,267 feet) stands as a majestic monument to nature. The Katahdin area is a spectacular landscape of mountains, meadows, swamps, cascades, sparkling lakes, river valleys, forests, cliffs, boulders, serrated ridges and deep glacial cirques.

The Route:
From Roaring Brook Campground to Lower Basin Pond: Chimney Pond Trail, 2.3 mile, 1.5 hrs
From Lower Basin Pond to Hamlin Peak (4751'): No.Basin Cut-off, North Basin trail and
Hamlin Ridge Trail, 2.3 mile, 2 hrs
From Hamlin Peak (4751') to Baxter Peak(5267'): NW Basin Trail and Saddle Trail, 2.2 mile, 2 hrs
From Baxter Peak (5267') to Pamola Peak (4902') via Knife Edge Trail, 1.1 mile, 1 hrs
From Pamola Peak (4902') back to Roaring Brook Campground: Helon Taylor Trail, 3.2 mile, 2 hrs

Total Elevation Gain:
3700'

Total Distance:
11.1 mile

Total Book Time:
10 hrs for this very challenging but rewarding hike

Disclaimer
Your response/signing up for a hike certifies that you have read, understand, and agree with the Disclaimer and things you must know.

Special Note:
This activity can be done individually or as part of the following itinerary. Please RSVP separately for each Meetup. Please email Scott at tourbusiness@altazone.com with any questions.

Thursday, July 10
Travel Day
1:00 pm D/P Portsmouth, New Hampshire
drive to West Forks, Maine
join Meetup group, Whitewater Rafting on the Kennebec River
organized by Michael Blair
Overnight:
Magic Rivers Campground

Friday, July 11
Whitewater Rafting on the Kennebec River
organized by Michael Blair
Overnight:
Magic Rivers Campground

Saturday, July 12
drive from West Forks to Baxter State Park
on route hike and ferry Mount Kineo, Moosehead Lake
Rockwood, Maine
organized by Scott

Overnight
Hidden Springs Campground (outside park on road to Baxter State Park)
www.hiddenspring.com
Note: you will be responsible for making your own reservations.

Sunday, July 13
hike Mt. Katahdin, Baxter State Park
www.baxterstateparkauthority.com
organized by Scott
our group will join members from the Random Group of Hikers who are also doing Katahdin on this day (RSVP to one site only)

Overnight
Hidden Springs Campground,

Monday, July 14
begin drive back home

stop in Rockland, Maine. Board ferry to Vinalhaven Island, Maine for bike ridding and swimming
www.vinalhaven.org

shopping stop at L.L. Bean in Freeport, Maine

Late Evening: Return Home
item.name: Maine's Highest Summit, Mt. Katahdin, Baxter State Park
